intro: Metalasia langebergensis, commonly known as the Langeberg metalasia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It produces a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, stout stem. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
